Name: Billy Bishop Park
Note: Street parking. Park is two blocks away from the library which has a parking lot and indoor washrooms.

Name: Capital Park
Note: A decent sized field for playing field games. Large spider web climbing structure, tire swing and a huge seesaw. Partially shaded park most of the day.

Name: Alexander Grove Park
Note: Near walking trail

Name: Hintonburg Park
Note: Proximity to Hintonburg Community Centre. Fenced but not gated.

Name: Pioneer Plains Park
Note: Near water & soccer field

Name: Cummings Park
Note: Ice skating during winter with a little building with a heater to get changed. Basketball, large grass field and diamond to play baseball.

Name: Roy G. Hobbs Community Centre and Park
Note: Beside community centre and large soccer field and baseball diamond

Name: Wilfred Murray Park / R.J. Kennedy Community Hall and Arena
Pierre Rocque Park
Note: Horseshoes and tennis courts and Baseball diamonds nearby

Name: Agincourt Park
Note: Sand box

Name: Palmerston Park
Note: There is a small spraying pole

Name: Ravine Park (Cumberland)
Note: Connected to a school - parking only on weekends

Name: Vanessa Gilles Park
Note: Baseball field, rink, very small baby park, fitness area for adults

Name: Queenswood Heights Centennial Park and Community Centre
Meadowbrook Park (Gloucester)
Accessibility: Accessible swing and structure with ramp

Name: Lindenlea Park
Note: Basketball court

Name: Regatta Park
Note: Has a small wooded area kids can explore - also has a slide built into the side of a hill which my kids think is super cool

Name: Raven Park
Note: Smaller play structure on mulch, large structure on sand base. Basketball ball court, large field for soccer etc.

Name: Barry Mullen Park
Note: Water access (public) nearby.

Name: Garneau Park
Note: baseball diamonds

Name: Varennes Park
Note: Soccer field

Name: Balena Park
Note: Toddler play structure

Name: Fawn Meadow Park
Note: Large dragon and climbable rock feature; nice short walking path around a pond

Name: St. Luke's Park
Note: Street parking around - basketball court and outside gym annexed to it

Name: Primrose Park
Note: This playground has no swing

Name: Woodroffe Park
Note: Large field for soccer etc. Baseball diamond. Part of large field is off leash dog park. On street parking only.

Name: Lionel Britton Park
Note: Trees that provide shade to the park all day. Fully fenced with a gate, and considered a toddler park for this reason. Neighbors have brought lots of toys to this park for the kids to enjoy like cars, diggers, etc.

Name: Maki Park
Note: Baseball diamond and soccer field. Great ice rink and pond rink in winter

Name: Sharel Park
Note: Shade all around, street parking, field and walking paths beside park

Name: Windsor Park Ottawa
Note: Massive area with 2 play structures, a wading pool and building for washrooms. Tire swing. Dedicated parking is at the end of Windsor avenue, holds 15-20 cars but is a 5 min walk from the playstructure and wading pool (you have to cross a large field)

Name: Laumann Park
Note: Only a small playstructure

Name: Gardenway Park
Note: This park is tricky. There are 3 parks for this location. One being park of a school. One being gated and for toddlers. They are not close enough to watch your children in all locations. The splash pad is close to the toddler section

Name: New Edinburgh Park
Note: Seasonal fountain in New Edinburgh Fieldhouse

Name: Proudmore Romina Park
Note: Separate toddler structure

Name: Elevation Park
Note: Also has a baseball diamond/soccer field space

Name: Owl Park
Note: Hills for sledding in the winter

Name: Loyola Park
Note: This park only has a splash pad, no play structure

Name: Bradley Ridge Park
Note: Large grass area and skating rink in the winter

Name: Alfred Taylor Recreation Facility - North Gower
Rabbi Bulka Kindness Park
Note: Obstacle course/challenge. Best suited for 7/8+ up to adults. Picnic table is accessible via paved walkways

Name: Springhurst Park
Note: Permanent ping pong table!

Name: River Mist Park
Note: Also has a sand pit section, and a very short wooded trail loop

Name: McKendry Park
Note: Baseball diamonds, soccer fields, arena in winter, huge covered gazebo area but not close to the actual playground. Bike trails/paths. 2 parking lots one off of McKendry drive is directly by the playground, main parking lot is huge and by the gazebo but a walk to the playground.

Name: Centrepointe Park
Note: The accessible swing is not the usual kind. Works for wheelchairs

Name: Constance Buckham's Bay Community Centre Park
Princess Margriet Park
Note: Tennis/pickleball court, space for dogs to socialize (leashed), open field space.

Name: Joe Rowan Park
Note: Large grass fields, covered gazebo area with multiple picnic tables, basketball court

Name: Britannia Park
Note: Beach access. Seasonal restaurant. Rentals. Two kids playgrounds. Huge beach.

Name: Diamond Jubilee Park
Address: 2810 Findlay Creek Drive / 4008 Kelly Farm Drive

Name: Dogwood Park and Munster Hamlet Community Centre
Crownridge Park
Note: Separate sandbox area. No seperate toddler area. Splash pad is directly next to structure

Name: Sieveright Park
Note: There is a small lot, but it's always been chained off

Name: Tanglewood Park
Note: Washroom is at the community centre

Name: Richelieu Park
Note: Washroom and water fountain at Vanier Library, or Richelieu-Vanier community centre. Parking lot is a 5+ minute walk from the playground.

Name: Andrew Haydon Park
Note: The splash beside is spray only. Lots of climbing structures on the park to the east. Huge walkable area

Name: Uplands Park
Note: Tennis Courts and Basketball Hoop

Name: Nault Park
Note: Partially fenced

Name: McCarthy Park
Note: Washrooms and water fountain in adjacent community centre, plenty of trees for shade

Name: Bramble Lane Park - Ridgewood Tot Lot
Carrol Homestead Community Park / Corkery Community Centre
Queenswood Ridge Park
Accessibility: Accessible swing and structure with ramp

Name: Half Moon Bay Park
Note: Soccer field and a pond which often has ducks in it

Name: Trappers Park
Note: Note from a Mom: The neighborhood children trash this park daily. Avoid at all costs

Name: Greenboro Park and Community Centre
Note: Washrooms and water fountain in the adjacent community centre

Name: Parkdale Park
Note: Washrooms are open when the farmer's market is open

Name: Cattail Creek Park
Note: Washrooms at Katimavik pool ~250m away

Name: Optimiste Park
Note: Bathroom and water fountain at Genest Pool

Name: Biley A. Blax Park
Note: The parking is close to city park drive, but the playground is off of Palmerston drive

Name: Houlahan Park and West Houlahan Park
Thornecliffe Park
Note: Splash pad is pretty small, main base is sand but there's mulch under the swings

Name: St. Paul's Park
Note: Partial fence

Name: Yves Richer Park
Note: 2 parks; one for younger children and one for older. Baseball diamond

Name: Laroche Park
Note: Sand pit is separate from play structure

Name: Dundonald Park
Note: Currently under construction, they are adding a splash pad (2025-06-25)

Name: St-Laurent Complex / Don Gamble Community Centre
Note: Washrooms and water fountain inside St-Laurent Complex

Name: Grenfell Glen Park
Note: Baseball field, tennis court, rink in winter time with a hut. Portapotties may not be permanent. Nearby walking trails connect to park.

Name: McKellar Park
Note: Large field for soccer, etc. Tennis courts. Baseball diamond. Basketball court. Access to bathrooms and water fountain when the fieldhouse is open.

Name: Ed Hollyer Park
Note: One small covered gazebo for anyone bringing their own table/chairs.

Name: Patrick Dugas Park
Note: Tennis court

Name: Centennial Park
Note: Washrooms and fountain are inside arena. When arena is open, access washroom though main doors. When arena is closed, there is a separate entrance to the washroom located by the parking lot.

Name: Stonemeadow Park
Note: Saucer swing

Name: Bluegrass Park
Note: Park is far away from road. Structure is not toddler friendly

Name: David Shentow Park
Note: Basketball court, large field for soccer

Name: Apollo Crater Park
Note: The majority of the park is occupied by pets and their owners, however there is a play area at the far east corner

Name: Montgomery Memorial Park / Old Town Hall Community Centre
Note: No shade

Name: Lakeview Park
Note: Full basketball court. Excellent ice rink and pond rink in winter

Name: March Central Community Centre and Park
Sylvia Holden Park
Note: Basketball court. There is a decent sized field that is sometimes used by local soccer camps. Most of the park is in the full sun, all day.

Name: Bilberry Park
Note: Track from school nearby

Name: Glebe Community Centre and St James Tennis Courts
Arnott Park
Note: Baby swings in full shade

Name: Joe Jamieson Park
Note: Volleyball court, basketball court, baseball field

Name: Medhurst Park
Note: They are supposed to be installing a splash pad by next summer so some of the info will change. There is parking but not right at the park (2025-06-25)

Name: Bathgate Park
Note: Play structure with slide. No swings at all. One bench

Name: Greely Village Park
Note: Soccer field, tennis court, basketball court, skate park and a pond with a walking trail

Name: Cappamore Park
Note: Also has gym structures for adults

Name: Glebe Memorial Park
Note: Decent sized field used for soccer. A community garden (off-limits). The park is partially enclosed by the fences of neighboring properties, but it has no gate and is open to a quiet local street.

Name: Inverness Park
Note: Baseball diamond, large field, skating rink in winter, basketball court

Name: Sawyer's Meadow Park
Note: Great structure for toddlers

Name: Marsha Park
Note: Beside a school, so parking is for school. Soccer field, tennis court and hockey rink.

Name: Helen Redpath Thomson Park
Note: Big spider web super fun for older kids.

Name: Leslie Armstrong Park and Bearbrook Community Hall
Ashton Park and Cavanagh Community Centre
Briargreen Park
Note: Shared city space - shared with school during school hours

Name: Plouffe Park
Note: Adjacent to community centre with indoor pool and washrooms.

Name: Big Bird Park
Note: Dog park nearby

Name: Frank Ryan Park
Note: Basketball courts, large fields, baseball fields

Name: Luc Major Park
Note: There is parking but not very much!

Name: Senator Eugene Forsey Park
Note: Basketball court. No real shade. Quiet park.

Name: Meadowbreeze Park
Note: Outdoor ice rink

Name: Valin Park and South Fallingbrook Community Centre
